com.github.dkanellis.fikey

Class FiKeyAuth

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.dkanellis.fikey.FiKeyAuth
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Authenticator

    public class FiKeyAuth
extends java.lang.Object
implements Authenticator
    The main class of the API which implements all the appropriate functionality in order for the U2F registration and login to be as simple as possible. The class can be instantiated with the default provided storages and settings or each storage and setting can be set separately at a developer's leisure.
    Author:
    Dimitris Kanellis

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void authenticateUser(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password) 
      java.lang.String finishDeviceAuthentication(java.lang.String response, java.lang.String username)
      Finishes the authentication of a device with a user by acquiring the user from the storage, then the response of the device, then matching the response against the request from our storage and then updating the device in the storage.
      java.lang.String finishDeviceRegistration(java.lang.String response, java.lang.String username)
      Finishes the registration of a device with a user by first acquiring the user from the storage, then the response of the device, then matching the response against the request from our storage and then adding the device to the user.

      • startDeviceRegistration

        public java.lang.String startDeviceRegistration(java.lang.String username)
                                         throws UserDoesNotExistException
        Initiates a registration of a device with a given user. We first get a reference to the user himself, then to the user's devices, then make the register request and then add that request to our U2fRequestStorage.
        Specified by:
        startDeviceRegistration in interface Authenticator
        Parameters:
        username - the user to add the device to
        Returns:
        the information of the register request
        Throws:
        UserDoesNotExistException - should not happen unless registerUser(String, String) failed

      • finishDeviceRegistration

        public java.lang.String finishDeviceRegistration(java.lang.String response,
                                                 java.lang.String username)
                                          throws UserDoesNotExistException
        Finishes the registration of a device with a user by first acquiring the user from the storage, then the response of the device, then matching the response against the request from our storage and then adding the device to the user.
        Specified by:
        finishDeviceRegistration in interface Authenticator
        Parameters:
        response - the device's response
        username - the user to add the device to
        Returns:
        the device's information
        Throws:
        UserDoesNotExistException - should not happen unless registerUser(String, String) failed

      • startDeviceAuthentication

        public java.lang.String startDeviceAuthentication(java.lang.String username)
                                           throws NoEligibleDevicesException,
                                                  UserDoesNotExistException
        Initiates a device authentication against the user. We first get the user from our storage, then a reference to the user's devices, then get the authenticate request data from said devices and then we add the request for authentication to our U2fRequestStorage.
        Specified by:
        startDeviceAuthentication in interface Authenticator
        Parameters:
        username - the user to check the device against
        Returns:
        the information of the authentication request
        Throws:
        UserDoesNotExistException - should not happen unless authenticateUser(String, String) failed
        NoEligibleDevicesException - no devices registered to the user or all his devices have been compromised

      • finishDeviceAuthentication

        public java.lang.String finishDeviceAuthentication(java.lang.String response,
                                                   java.lang.String username)
                                            throws DeviceCompromisedException,
                                                   UserDoesNotExistException
        Finishes the authentication of a device with a user by acquiring the user from the storage, then the response of the device, then matching the response against the request from our storage and then updating the device in the storage.
        Specified by:
        finishDeviceAuthentication in interface Authenticator
        Parameters:
        response - the device's response
        username - the user to add the device to
        Returns:
        the device's information
        Throws:
        UserDoesNotExistException - should not happen unless registerUser(String, String) failed
        DeviceCompromisedException - the device has either been compromised or its counter is too low
